Ok, so I now have a database containing 981,706 interjections extracted from the Hansard of both houses from 1901-1980.

For #AustraliaDay I’m extracting debates relating to the 1901 Immigration Restriction Bill (i.e. White Australia Policy) from Hansard.

Stepping away from RecordSearch before I do something unwise...
So I need to harvest the functions YET AGAIN and try to correct for the inconsistencies…
And even though EDUCATION AND TRAINING is listed as a broader term for TERTIARY EDUCATION, it’s not actually used…… https://t.co/l6bi6LN3uW
ARRGH!! @naagovau RecordSearch functions hierarchy is internally inconsistent. Going down it's EDUCATION, going up EDUCATION AND TRAINING.
@treen42 There must be a law against hierarchies with more than 3 levels...
So once again I will start harvesting agencies by function, so I can once again attempt to get back to my original question…

Oh FFS. While other @naagovau functions thesauri are 3 levels deep, the functions hierarchy in RecordSearch is at least 5 levels… #goingmad

Ok, set up regular monthly payment to @internetarchive. Its work seems more important than ever (and I use it all the time!).

I love it when you start on some routine computational task and… something happens… things appear… you tweak a bit… and then… oh. yes.
@edsu I’m not doing anything clever. Just extracting interjections from Hansard XML and printing to screen if they’re less than 20 chars.

I think I finally understand what it is that I do. I wonder if this fleeting sense of clarity will evaporate if I try to write it down...
So I think I’ve now found & harvested the basic function hierarchies from AGIFT versions 1, 2 & 3. JSON files here: https://t.co/S4S0l1j5YB
So between 2000 and 2015, the AGIFT term moved from ‘Community protection — Coastal surveillance’ to ‘National security — Border control’.
And in the 1st edition of AGIFT there was ‘Community protection’ rather than ‘National security’. https://t.co/9cuR5ERLIG
@HughRundle yep ‘Border protection’...
@TroveAustralia Although you don’t have to be registered to add public tags...
‘Coastal surveillance’ is now a ‘non preferred term’ in @naagovau AGIFT. https://t.co/5de1HUTBLo Categories are political folks...
Hmm so AGIFT’s 3rd edition (2015) changed the 'National security - Coastal surveillance’ function to ‘National security - Border protection'

Still exploring the data, which is a bit rubbery in places. Hoping to better understand patterns in access/digitisation.
But about 70% of those @naagovau digitised items come from just 20 series. https://t.co/PbAu4BJPAr
From @naagovau data I harvested late last year, it seems there are 10,727, 214 items described on RecordSearch. 1,769,967 are digitised.
RecordSearch seems to be taking the whole unknown soldier thing a bit far… @naagovau https://t.co/8JYNHAvmpd
@egroucutt @naagovau There just seems to be a lot more variation in control symbols than is documented in the notes. Don’t know why...
Not that anyone cares, but you really can’t rely on the arrangement notes in @naagovau RecordSearch’s series descriptions…
@rosalindaymes @PapersPastNZ But you can construct complex searches (proximity, boolean etc) on @DigitalNZ & then paste url into QueryPic.
@rosalindaymes @PapersPastNZ It uses the @DigitalNZ API so search options are limited. Don’t think you can search by newspaper title/region.
@PapersPastNZ @rosalindaymes Just started work on a new version as well...
